snippet: At a recent dinner at the United States consulate in Jerusalem, a Swiss-born chef was given a challenge of making a menu derived from West Bank food purveyors.
abstract: Michael Ratney, United States consul general in Israel, hosts dinner party offering menu prepared from ingredients almost exclusively purchased from West Bank food purveyors underwritten by funds from United States; meal is meant to showcase export potential of Palestinian producers at a time when US aid is under criticism from Israel.
lead_paragraph: At a recent dinner at the United States consulate in Jerusalem, a Swiss-born chef was given a challenge of making a menu derived from West Bank food purveyors.

headline.main: Appreciating the Flavors of West Bank
headline.print_headline: Palestinian Ingredients, Served With Dash of Diplomacy
